name: Kung Pao Shrimp
author: Lisa Somerset
summary: Kung pao shrimp is a fantastic dish that always goes down well! Serve with rice.
ingredients: ½ pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 (8 ounce) can sliced bamboo shoots, drained
1  green bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch slices
2 tablespoons salted peanuts, or to taste
directions: Combine soy sauce, chicken broth, and sesame oil in a bowl
Dissolve cornstarch in water and mix into the bowl
Add shrimp and stir to coat
Cover and refrigerate for 1 1/2 hours; stir occasionally
Mix chicken broth, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch together to make the sauce
Heat oil in a large frying pan
Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until limp and translucent, about 5 minutes
Add shrimp and stir until pink, about 1 minute
Stir in bamboo shoots, bell peppers, and dried chile; cook for 1 minute
Cook until sauce boils and thickens slightly, about 5 minutes
